citation.article-title: Haloarcula marismortui (Volcani) sp. nov., nom. rev., an extremely halophilic bacterium from the Dead Sea.

p.s: Description of Haloarcula marismortui sp. nov., nom. rev.
Haloarcula marismortui (ma.ris.mor'u.i. L. n. mare, the sea; L. gen. n. maris, of the sea; L. adj. mortuus, dead; M. L. gen. n. marismortui, of the Dead Sea)
Cells are pleomorphic, flat, and disk-shaped (1 to 2 by 2 to 3 μm).
Nonmotile (but rarely cells are observed to rotate around their axes).
Growth occurs in media containing 1.7 to 5.1 M NaCl (optimum NaCl concentration, 3.4 to 3.9 M).
Can grow anaerobically with nitrate as an electron acceptor.
Utilizes a range of compounds as sole carbon and energy sources (glucose, fructose, sucrose, glycerol, acetate, succinate, and malate).
Produces acid from glucose, fructose, ribose, xylose, maltose, sucrose, mannitol, sorbitol, and glycerol.
Nitrate is reduced with production of gas and nitrite.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the major DNA component is 62 mol%, and the guanine-plus-cytosine content of the minor component is 55 mol%.
The type strain is strain ATCC 43049.
